title: Person injured by falling concession sign near Fenway Park, police say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The man was taken to a local hospital Thursday with a head laceration, according to Boston police.
Jersey Street, pictured in 2020.

AP Photo/Michael Dwyer, File By Abby Patkin December 5, 2025 | 10:55 AM 1 minute to read A man was sent to the hospital with a head injury Thursday night after he was struck by a sign that fell from a concession stand outside Fenway Park, according to Boston police.

title: Victim allegedly hit with glass bottle, put in headlock during Dorchester robbery
author: John Waller
bullets: Crime Officers arrested a 38-year-old woman but were unable to locate a second suspect.
By John Waller December 5, 2025 | 10:38 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A 38-year-old woman was arrested Wednesday after a victim flagged down police in Dorchester and told them he was struck in the head with a glass bottle and put in a headlock during a robbery.

title: N.H. man allegedly cuts off family in traffic, including small child and infant, smashes their windshield with baseball bat
author: John Waller
bullets: Crime The 21-year-old man also allegedly made threats during the incident.
By John Waller December 5, 2025 | 10:31 AM 1 minute to read A family in New Hampshire apparently got quite the scare on Thursday.
According to Salem, New Hampshire police, a 21-year-old man cut them off in traffic near Rockingham Park Boulevard at about 6:25 p.

title: Botulism outbreak linked to infant formula spreads to Mass.
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Parents and caregivers should look out for symptoms of infant botulism like constipation, trouble feeding, and loss of head control.
A national outbreak of infant botulism spread to Massachusetts last week.
The outbreak has been ongoing since early August.

title: Livestream: Day 5 of the Brian Walshe murder trial
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime A State Police digital cellphone forensic specialist will return to the stand for cross-examination.
Livestream via NBC10 Boston.

On Thursday afternoon, a Massachusetts State Police digital forensic expert, Connor Keefe, revealed in Norfolk Superior Court what investigators say they uncovered from two cellphones linked to Brian Walshe.

title: Red Sox reportedly have ‘big interest’ in signing Japanese infielder
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox are reportedly one of the teams who have expressed a “big interest” in Okamoto — alongside the Blue Jays and Pirates.
Kazuma Okamoto had six seasons of 30-plus homers in Japan.

(AP Photo/Hiro Komae, File) By Conor Ryan December 5, 2025 | 7:39 AM 1 minute to read One of the top priorities this offseason for Craig Breslow and the Red Sox’ front office is adding more pop to the lineup — preferably at an infield position.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.

bullets: Quizzes Ticketmaster trauma, some tax and train troubles, and a cranberry conundrum are all part of this week’s news quiz.
